title.narrative: Community Resilience to Vulnerabilities (CRV) in Azerbaijan

description.narrative: This project seeks to assist the Government of Azerbaijan’s response to combating trafficking in persons and consequently, transnational organized crime, and to improve protection mechanisms in providing migrants, as well as victims/potential victims of trafficking (VoT), with appropriate assistance services. The action will enhance the institutional capacities of civil society shelters in delivering high quality rehabilitation and reintegration services in a sustainable manner. It will also equip the shelters with knowledge and skills towardensuring best coordination among the governmental agencies and civil society organizations. Additionally, it will strengthen care and supportinterventions to VoTs and their families. IOM will promote continuation of dialogue and strengthen coordination and communication between the civil society organizations, relevant state agencies and international organizations on practical aspects related to the implementation of counter-trafficking legislation of Azerbaijan in line with European and international standards. IOM with its civil society partners will raise awareness among the local population and migrants on the risks of irregular migration and dangers of trafficking, and provide direct assistance to migrants, victims/potential VoTs who need legal assistance, accommodation and reintegration and other forms of support.

participating-org.narrative: United States Agency for International Development (USAID)

mailing-address.narrative: Yashar Husseynov Street 18, Baku AZ 1069, Azerbaijan

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

provider-org.narrative: United States Agency for International Development (USAID)
